alert.note: Alert for Rockingham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 6:54AM EDT until May 27 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina and Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in north central North Carolina, Rockingham and Stokes. In Virginia, City of Martinsville, Franklin and Henry. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 654 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Bassett Branch, Big Chestnut Creek, Baker Branch, Belews Creek, Big Beaver Island Creek and Beaver Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eden... Martinsville... Rocky Mount... Wentworth... Mayodan... Madison... Walnut Cove... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
